Division

Steel Dynamics

Overview

This internship is for Summer 2026 in the quality and product development department. 

Responsibilities

  • Assist quality and product developmentdepartment in strategic projects and administration
  • Analyze product and quality data and develop reports for presentation to management
  • Other duties as assigned

Qualifications

  • Pursuing a BS in metallurgical engineering, materials engineering, or related discipline, at least a sophomore class standing
  • GPA 3.0 or above
  • Ability to work at least 30 hours per week
  • Strong professional verbal and written communication skills
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, team coordination, and the ability to work with all levels of management, clients and vendors
  • Must be self-driven and able to complete tasks without specific direction
  • Ability to meet deadlines
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Experience in Microsoft Office is highly desired with preference for experience in statistical analysis

 

Steel Dynamics, Inc., and all affiliated entities are equal opportunity employers.
